definition: A large meal, typically one in celebration of something.
sentence: They prepared a feast for the holiday.

definition: Having an affection or liking for.
sentence: She is very fond of her pet cat.

definition: An amount of teaching given at one time; a period of learning or teaching.
sentence: He takes piano lessons every week.

definition: To quickly seize something in a rude or eager way.
sentence: He managed to snatch the last cookie.

definition: Accounts of imaginary or real people and events told for entertainment.
The offspring of a male donkey and a female horse.
sentence: The mule carried the heavy load up the mountain.

definition: A wind instrument made from a tube with holes along it that are stopped by the fingers or keys.
sentence: She played a beautiful melody on the flute.
The treasure was buried in the sand.

definition: To break free from confinement or control.
sentence: The prisoners planned to escape from the jail.

definition: The natural home or environment of an animal, plant, or other organism.
sentence: The forest is the natural habitat of many species.

definition: An act of traveling from one place to another.
sentence: They went on a long journey across the country.

definition: The phenomena of the physical world collectively, including plants, animals, the landscape, and other features and products of the earth.
sentence: She enjoys spending time in nature.
He peeks through the window to see who is outside.

definition: People who secretly collect and report information on the activities, movements, and plans of an enemy or competitor.
sentence: The spies gathered intelligence on the enemy.

definition: An aromatic or pungent vegetable substance used to flavor food.
sentence: She added a pinch of spice to the soup.

definition: A continuous area or expanse that is free, available, or unoccupied.
sentence: There is enough space for everyone to sit.
